thread.title: Filipinos in UK urged to be vigilant after London attack
thread.title_full: Filipinos in UK urged to be vigilant after London attack

author: Alexander Magno
title: Filipinos in UK urged to be vigilant after London attack
text:
By: Anthony Q. Esguerra - Social Media Specialist / @AEsguerraINQ INQUIRER.net / 01:35 AM March 23, 2017 Emergency services staff provide medical attention close to the Houses of Parliament in London, Wednesday, March 22, 2017. London police say they are treating a gun and knife incident at Britain’s Parliament “as a terrorist incident until we know otherwise.” The Metropolitan Police says in a statement that the incident is ongoing. Officials say a man with a knife attacked a police officer at Parliament and was shot by officers. Nearby, witnesses say a vehicle struck several people on the Westminster Bridge. (Photo by MATT DUNHAM / AP) 
The Philippine Embassy in London on Wednesday (Thursday, PHT) urged Filipinos living and working in the United Kingdom to remain vigilant after a knife attack and car rampage in London that left two people dead. READ: At least 2 dead in car rampage, knife attack in London 
“In view of the firearms incident outside @UKParliament, we advise Filipinos in London to remain vigilant & monitor UK security advisories,” the embassy posted on its Twitter account. 
The British Parliament was on lockdown Wednesday after an assailant stabbed an officer. The attacker was shot by police. ADVERTISEMENT 
Around the same time, a vehicle mowed down pedestrians on nearby Westminster Bridge. In view of the firearms incident outside @UKParliament , we advise Filipinos in London to remain vigilant & monitor UK security advisories. pic.twitter.com/eTV1comAxx 
— Philippine Embassy (@philippinesinuk) March 22, 2017 
The threat level for international terrorism in the UK was listed at severe. Wednesday was the anniversary of suicide bombings in the Brussels airport and subway that killed 32 people. 
Authorities said they were treating the attack as a “terrorist incident until we know otherwise.” /atm
